snippet: As Greece completed its bailout accord, Lawrence Summers, President Obama’s former economic adviser, said, “You can’t really claim there’s a viable growth model for Europe.”
abstract: Lawrence Summers, former economic adviser to Pres Obama, warns that austerity measures and strict budgetary guidelines imposed by the European Union may have the unintended consequence of preventing growth.
lead_paragraph: As Greece completed its bailout accord, Lawrence Summers, President Obama’s former economic adviser, said, “You can’t really claim there’s a viable growth model for Europe.”

headline.seo: Summers Cautions on Drawbacks of Austerity in Europe
headline.main: Summers Urges Europeans Not to Neglect Growth
headline.print_headline: Summers Cautions on Drawbacks of Austerity in Europe
